reviews.sentence: Totally contented with our stay. Stayed for a week here just after Christmas. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and have nothing really to complain about and much to praise the hotel for. The room was spacious the views towards the south quite breath taking and the balcony added a nice touch as we got lots of fresh air. Most hotels have not got the option of opening the windows or doors to the outside. Our room was serviced at a very convenient time when we were out and it was very clean. Reception staff was very polite and so was the concierge. We hired a car and had it valet parked. There was only a slight problem one day when the car was moved when it should not have been. However this was only very minor to us as we were not in a hurry. Just a little hint if you have your car valet parked ask for it giving yourself time and specify a time when you want it. They do get very busy at times. The restaurant Redsalt was a real blessing. We have good breakfasts there and we had a wonderful New Years Eve dinner there. A friend came to visit from Sydney and we were not sure where to have dinner with him on New Years Eve. We were so glad we picked Redsalt as it turned out to be our best restaurant in Adelaide both for the food and the service. This is saying a lot because we did try a number of places in the CBD North Adelaide as well as the Adelaide Hills and Barosa Valley. All in all we would gladly stay at the Crowne Plaza Adelaide again.

Very Good Hotel I can not see why you would not be happy here. 4 Nights no issues at all We usually stay with the Shangri La Group when traveling so I was very Interested to see what this type of hotel would offer. Cant fault the service in all departments breakfast was very good location is excellent more or less in the centre of the CBD. Paid a little extra for a view with a better city well worth it.

Just what we needed for our short stay. We needed to stay one night in Adelaide since the flight times from Kangaroo Island did not mesh with a flight to Melbourne. We could have stayed at the airport but we thought catching a glimpse of the city might be good. We had very little time to explore and barely made it out of the hotel lobby during our 18 hours. Our room was fine nice bathroom and decent dinner in the hotel dining room. Breakfast however was annoying since it was only an elaborate buffet so we went next door to a coffee shop for a quick breakfast. No complaints but perhaps staying at the airport might have been a more economical option.

Perfectly located hotel. Crowne Plaza is right where all the action is yet somehow remains peaceful and quiet within. Round the corner to Adelaides main Rundle Mall where you will find a great variety of shops and cinemas and eateries including pubs. Also an easy and pleasant walk to the SA Art Gallery and Museum. The hotel itself presented very well as one arrives at its front entrance staffed by very friendly and helpful staff at concierge and check in counter. Our room was a good size with a balcony overlooking Hindmarsh Park. Lovely. Despite being in the heart of the city it was peaceful within the walls apart from the occasional police fire sirensHousekeping was excellent over the six nights we were there. Room service was the fastest we have experienced delivered with a smile. The buffet breakfast very good did become a little repetitive after the third morning and we would have welcomed a change in just a couple of the hot selections. We were very pleased by their inclusion of a fresh fruit juicer. Nice touch. All the mothers were presented with a boxed cupcake on Mothers Day breakfast. A lovely gestureHospitality at its best.

Nice hotel right beside Rundle Street Mall. We got the junior suite with the included breakfast. Best value package tin my opinion. Breakfast were excellent and room was cozy.

Exceptional. Great location in the center of Adelaide. We stayed in a junior suite on the fourth floor. The room was spacious well appointed and quiet bed very comfortable. Friendly helpful staff at reception and in the bar and dinning room. We will be back. Trevor Judy. Nothing.

Exceptional. Great location within walking distance of Festival Theatre. restaurants and Rundle Mall. Staff are very friendly and helpful and to be offered valet parking. meant I did nt have to worry about finding a safe affordable park.

Great hotel and very central. Staff were helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Pullman. Thank you for making us feel very welcome. You could certainly notice that the staff had been well trained. The only disappointment during our stay was when we were charged valet parking even though we were ACOR members. This was because we had not booked direct through ACOR. It might be worth mentioning this to ACOR for anyone else choosing this travel option. We loved our breakfast in the morning too and there was certainly plenty to choose from in the buffet display. It was great to see chef making fresh omelettes and eggs and bacon etc however seeing the hollandaise sauce being squeezed from a bottle was not really necessary. It would have been more impressive having it freshly made. Keep up the good work team Pullman and we would definitely make a return visit if we travelled back to Adelaide for another holiday. Well done and thank you. Concierge staff went out of their way to assist us with where to go and what to do. They also recommended local eateries. Great hotel team work.

Excellent hotel in great location. My wife and I loved our stay. Very well managed and friendly helpful staff. The rooms were spacious and beautifully appointed. The hotel is in a great location with easy access to all points of interest in the city and a short walk to Adelaide oval. Breakfast was sensational with all you could wish for including a juicer to make your own healthy juices. Eggs and omelettes were cooked to your liking. Loved the Bircher Meusli. We ate in the restaurant once and the meal was lovely and great service. Also dined in room one night and food was also excellent. can not speak highly enough of the staff who could not do enough for guests. Special mention to Asta who found out where we travelling to next and prepared a list of suggested places to see. Would highly recommend this hotel and we would definitely stay again when next visiting Adelaide.

Nice stay. We found it a bit hard to find at first coming into Adelaide and there is only Valet parking. No problem we found parking around the hotel and did nt cost us a cent without difficulty at all. Location is great as well. Rooms were clean comfortable and quiet. We had been assigned our room right next to the lifts which I was not thrilled about but heard nothing either night and had a great sleep. We did not eat at the hotel but the breakfast did look great. Did have a bit of difficulty checking in with payment but think that was an Acor mistake not so much the hotel. Staff were great would stay again in Adelaide very central.

I liked it would have to bring my own pillow next time. The service was impeccable. Great value as I got a Bokingcom 40 off deal. The pillows. Bloody terrible. They look good and are ok to cuddle but that is about it. I ordered pillows from the pillow menu to try and get the right one only a tontine type one was suitable. The latex one was like concrete with a pillow slip. Get rid of them. they were not anything like a proper latex pillow. The air conditioner in 824 was noisy. Turn it on and have a listen to it all night. The TV was difficult to get channels to work as well. I think its the remote.

very pleasant beautiful room comfy bed and quiet place. Apart from an issue at checkin with my booking which I did on your website the staff managed it well giving us a free drink in the bar while it was sorted. All else was just lovely.

Have always enjoyed this hotel but unfortunately our most recent stay was not what we had always enjoyed. There appeared to be a lot of inconsistencies in what hotel services were available. One staff member offered us a breakfast service which we were later denied when we went back to reception to confirm. Did not feel like a five star hotel. Little things in the room do make a difference there is normally a pen and paper to write notes. when I opened the fridge one whole shelf of mini bar drinks fell out onto my foot. Staff were later apologetic about the breakfast dispute after we decided to pass comment. Unfortunately our stay was already ruined. Did not feel comfortable walking thru reception or eating at the restaurant or ordering room service and ate all meals away from the hotel. Thank you for taking the time to read this. Paul and Bron.

Very enjoyable stay. We booked a Junior suite for 2 nights and were suitable impressed. Our room was a corner room with views to the south across the city to the hills. It was lovely. The room was spacious and comfortable particularly the king sized bed. The extra large shower cubicle was great as was the enormous bath. The little things like bath robes and toiletries were good too. There is only one thing that disappointed us greatly was the milk. Is it possible that you can have fresh milk in the rooms. Long life milk is just awful. We enjoyed breakfast in the restaurant too. Great selection to choose from. Our room was the very last room at the end of the corridor so it was very quiet. Overall it was really really enjoyable. Oh and when we checked in we were asked whether it was a special occasion and it was. Our anniversary. It was lovely to then receive a bottle of wine and chocolates with the hotel compliments. Very nice.

Amazing weekend away at Pullman Adelaide. My first time visited Adelaide for Monet Exhibition. After a very long drive with my friend we arrived in one piece at Pullman Adelaide. Hotel lobby is very lovely with beautiful sense fragrance. We arrived quite late the night however I felt very welcomed by front office staff Marc the young gentle man at reception. The check in was quick and smooth. As I mentioned we are here for the exhibition Marc provided us map and information immediately. Thank you Marc been so helpful and professional. The hotel room was comfortable and spotless clean. Even though we did not get to see much of the city view. But we were still very excited and satisfied for our Adelaide trip. Hotel is very central located. Walking distance to the main shopping mall and other entertaining spots from the hotel was just what I expected. We had lovely dinner in the SALT restaurant. The steak was very tasty and perfectly cooked. I am not sure if the sauce being a good match to the steak though so i ordered some other sauce to match my steak instead. My friend also enjoyed her barramundi dish very much. Thank you Pullman to accommodate us. We certainly had a comfortable and enjoyable stay. I will surely come back to stay with you again.
Just very relaxing. I was at tje Pylman for working and I enjoyed everthing except the Breakfast coffee. I went to the cafe next door for coffee.

Checking in was the best part of the experience. When we arrived we were checked in by assistant manager Michael Sleep. He was professional knowledgeable and helpful. It was a great first impression as this was our first stay at a Pullman hotel. Have to say though that rest of our stay was pretty ordinary. Booked two rooms and pre paid breakfast for both but upon arriving at the restaurant in the morning we were told that only one room came with breakfast. Luckily I had my email with booking confirmation on my phone. Breakfast was fine but nothing special. Went to the pool only to find there were no towels which we later found tucked up high on a shelf in the wardrobe back in our room. No dry areas to sit in the pool area either. All the lounges has wet cushions. We ’re also members of IHG and normally stay at IHG hotels and have to admit that the overall experience they provide is well above this short stay we had at Pullman Adelaide.

Relaxing. Excellent service from reception and concierge. The room was large clean light and modern. The best location in the city allows you easy access to most places. We really enjoyed our dinner and breakfast however the service in the restaurant in the evening was not up to our expectations.

Fabulous except the parking. We arrived on the Friday 15th for a 4 day stay including breakfast. It was our intention originally to not have a car so I did not really research the parking costs. Our plane was delayed so we got into the city a little later than expected and decided to park by meter 820 for two hrs. ouch ok not to worry we will sort out later. As I am an Acor Member the ease of Check In is wonderful. Unfortunately no matter how nice the Reception was they could not get us an economical park. Anyways Room 1421 tho not as Posh as I expected was lovely and once the balcony was unlocked the view beautiful even on a rainy day. We had breakfast on all days very nice. A couple of pizzas wine and a main meal at Pullman. Service lovely. Food excellent and great value with Acor card. Top wine menu tho I would expect no less from South Australia. Was overall a lovely visit. We came to see the Firebirds play Thunderbirds. Our team Won. What can I say. Thankyou. South Australia. Your City. Your Food Excellent as always.

Happy Acorplus couple. We enjoy frequently visiting the City were very happy with the speedy booking in at reception our room was perfect with a very pleasant view across the park. The hotel is conveniently located to feel part of the City though peaceful quiet. Our only disappointment was the Salt Bar Lunch. The menu was more suited to a Burger Bar. Two condiments not requested arrived at the table they remained unopened though we were charged for them. The snack was overpriced not enjoyable.

Nice hotel room but service and in room dining let it down. My hotel room was well appointed and the bed very comfortable. I was also updated to a superior room at no extra charge which was nice. Unfortunately there was no one to greet me at the entrance when I pulled up in my car despite check in not being very busy. I have been staying at this hotel for years even before it was a Pullman and there used to be more of a fuss made over returning guests. My in room dining meal was very disappointing especially for the excessive price. This has been the case for my last 3 visits. The buffet breakfast was quite good although they had no record of my pre paying for breakfast on their guest list when I arrived at the dining room. The valet did not have my car ready at my requested time and I had to wait while the lady at the check out counter rushed out to get my car which made me late to my appointment.
All excellent except for the breakfast. Great. All staff were friendly room was spotless and facilities were great. It was just the breakfast experience that let you down.
Enjoyable. Staff were friendly and helpful. The diners space is a bit small.
Not happy with having to move rooms and than there was no extra pillows or blankets in the room available. Even breakfast waiting on eggs being made I waited 20mins and still no answer.

Fantastic hotel very comfortable room. However the dining experience was poor. The menu is not really set up for a single business person staying one night. Limited menu had to buy minimum of 2 courses and vegetables were extra. Very expensive and a very ordinary dining experience. This tarnished my stay at what otherwise is an excellent hotel.

Lovely stay. Our one night stay was lovely. The room was beautiful and the bed and pillows incredibly soft and luxurious. We particularly enjoyed the pool gym and spa. We were a little disappointed at breakfast. The food was lovely however we felt we were not afforded the same service as guests dining around us. Upon arrival at breakfast we were told to ‘ sit wherever we liked ’ and were not offered coffee or given an explanation on how to order a cooked breakfast. Otherwise our stay was perfect.

Great location and facilities. 3 night stay first time in Adelaide in 30 years. Reception staff very good. Room well appointed comfortable bed. Ate at the restaurant Sunday night a little disappointed. Our order was lost and my waygu steak was quite tough. My wifes meal was very good. Menu quite extensive and reasonably priced. Breakfast very good. Guest laundry much appreciated. Hotel facilities very good. Great location close to the mall and lots of restaurants bars and hotels nearby.

Generally good but could get small things a bit better right. Stayed here for 6 nights. The room was generally good very good gym area. Great location. The areas for improvement are in relation to my membership of Acor Live Platinum level. First I paid for breakfast in advance online but in check in was told I was entitled to complementary breakfast in the executive lounge. Surely this information should be available on booking to affix spending needlessly. Secondly compared to other hotels in Acor group the welcome present etc was significantly inferior.

Exceptional. On mentioning it was my husbands birthday they sent up special dessert tray. Room comfortable bed comfortable. Choice of pillows. Large tv. Efficient and friendly check in and check out. Lovely meal at Salt restaurant buffet breakfast was good. Liked everything.
